alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 6:18AM CDT until June 02 at 3:13AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Kansas, including the following county, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Holton, Hoyt, Mayetta, Denison, Delia and Potawatomi Reservation.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
